page.title: 03HONEY,FENSTANTON
page.content: {Honey}Hill,the oldest part of Fenstanton was believed once to have a{honey}market on the green.Today in the post office they sell{fresh honey. {Mr Hobbs}owns 18 hives.In 1984 he got{1/4 ton of honey from 12 hives. Most of Mr Hobbs honey is made from } rape.Bees can fill a frame in one day Some work faster than others but they work faster if smoked .The machine is filled with cardboad which creates smoke.In the old days nearly everyone produced their own honey. In winter bees stay in the brude chamber to keep warm.The{brude}is the bottom half of the bee hive and the{super}is at the top.All the{workers}are female and in a hive the average amount is 4,0000 to 6,0000.The{queen bee}lays her own weight of eggs.Sometimes she leaves and she does the workers follow.This is called a{swarm.
